trans-unit.source: Once you create or connect to a database within a system, begins outputting information and error messages to the error log. Typically, writes this information to a file called derby.log in the system directory.

seg-source.mrk: Once you create or connect to a database within a system, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> begins outputting information and error messages to the error log.
Typically, writes this information to a file called derby.log in the system directory.

target.mrk: Once you create or connect to a database within a system, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> begins outputting information and error messages to the error log.
Typically, writes this information to a file called derby.log in the system directory.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can have send messages to a stream, using the derby.stream.error.method or derby.stream.error.field property, or to a different file, using the derby.stream.error.file property. If you use any of these properties, the property setting will appear in the log.

seg-source.mrk: Alternatively, you can have send messages to a stream, using the derby.stream.error.method or derby.stream.error.field property, or to a different file, using the derby.stream.error.file property.
If you use any of these properties, the property setting will appear in the log.

target.mrk: Alternatively, you can have send messages to a stream, using the derby.stream.error.method or derby.stream.error.field property, or to a different file, using the derby.stream.error.file property.
If you use any of these properties, the property setting will appear in the log.

trans-unit.source: By default, overwrites derby.log when you start the system. You can configure to append to the log with the derby.infolog.append property.

seg-source.mrk: By default, overwrites derby.log when you start the system.
You can configure to append to the log with the derby.infolog.append property.

target.mrk: By default, overwrites derby.log when you start the system.
You can configure to append to the log with the derby.infolog.append property.

trans-unit.source: For information on setting all of these properties, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For information on setting all of these properties, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.

target.mrk: For information on setting all of these properties, see the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citref"></ph>.
